task-wr.title: Adjusting Resources on a Compute Node
task-wr.shortdesc: You can adjust the resources of a compute node while it is offline.

step.cmd: CGTS-3654 add stepDelete the host from the inventory.

info.p: Wind River recommends that you delete the host and re-install it to ensure that any resource changes, such as device name reassignments, are correctly recorded in the inventory.

note.p: Ensure that the host is Online, so that its disk is erased when it is deleted from the inventory. This ensures that the host boots from the network when it is powered up for re-installation. If the host is not online when it is deleted from the inventory, then during re-installation you may need to force a network boot.

info.p: In the Actions column, open the drop-down list for the host, and then select Delete Host.

stepresult.p: The storage node is removed from the Hosts list, and the Titanium Server software is removed from its hard drive.

step.cmd: Make any required resource changes (for example, BIOS changes required for proper operation).

info.p: If you are adding a disk to provide additional local storage for VMs, you can install an unpartitioned disk. New disks are detected by the compute node operating system and automatically configured with a single partition.

step.cmd: CGTS-3654 revised step to call for re-installation and reconfiguration. Install the modified host as a node on Titanium Server.

info.p: To ensure that changes to the host are correctly recorded in the system inventory, perform a full initialization and configuration. For detailed instructions, refer to Titanium Server Installation.

result.p: When the host is reported as Unlocked, Enabled, and Available, it is ready for use with the adjusted resources.
